attributes.action: Restrain calling the B 1.617.2 as Indian Variant
attributes.additional_details: Kindly restrain the media from calling the B.1.617.2 as Indian variant and call it in a region agnostic name.
attributes.background: WHO named the novel corona virus as COVID 19 to avoid any regional stigma ; The same principle should be extended to the corona virus variants too. So calling the new variant (B 1.617.2) as Indian variant  is not right.

rejection.details:
This is a matter for individual media organisations and journalists, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to only refer to the 'India variant' as B.1.617.2 in all Government communications, including press briefings, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

If you do start another petition, please ensure you include your full name as we can't accept petitions started with just a forename.
